page.title: 14A Solihull Estate Agent.
page.content: The{estate agent}told us that in this area women were more interested in the bathroom and the kitchen and these two features would usually sell a house, although a large garden was also a big selling feature. Certain people would only ever buy a new house but a common complaint was that gardens of new houses were often thought to be too small. The reason for this was that land was so expensive that builders often had to make gardens smaller so that they could fit more houses ,on to a plot. Brickwork and double cavities made houses more heat efficient nowadays, though it probably made them carry more noise through party walls. Wood was no longer seasoned for a long time in the open but dried artificially and this made wood go rotten very quickly.
